intro: Prosorus gaertneri, commonly known as the Gaertner's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky soils. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs. Prosorus gaertneri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
